text.p: These are the leading stories in Zambia's newspapers on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines workers are up in arms over reports that several top mining positions in Zambia have been advertised in the South African press.
- The government throws out a reccomendation by a university special committee that the University of Zambia, which closed after student unrest early this year, re-open this month.
- Turborep of South Africa expresses interest in opening a branch in Zambia to manufacture underground mine compressors.
- Home affairs minister Chitalu Sampa says the government has began moving Zairean soldiers who sought asylum in Zambia to safe areas within the country.

- The central bank dispells sentiments that the fall in interest rates for treasury bills is induced, saying it is a true reflection of the money market following a steady fall in the rate of inflation.
- The International Labour Organisation expresses concern at Zambia's high unemployment rate, which stands at 3.4 million of the country's nine million people.
